reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here as guests at a wedding and found this venue to be excellent. The grounds have a real 'wow' factor with a lovley lake and decking that extends out from the function area and overlooks it all. The B&B room we stayed in itself was small but tastefully decorated and very clean. The only negative for us was that breakfast finished at 9:30am and after being at a wedding all day for the previous day there was no way that was going to be doable, especially with checkout being 10am! That's just a personal opinion on not being a morning person! There were kitchen facilities to prepare your own snacks though so that's helpful and tea/coffee making facilities in the room so you can do your own refreshments. I would highly recommend this venue for both the accomodation and for the whole wedding package.
reviews.title: Great accomodation - fabulous surrounding grounds

reviews.text: We stayed here recently with a baby and had a great time. The staff were very friendly and the room was clean. The environment is astounding, with a huge lake, swans, ducks, ponies, and goats. We would consider staying again.
reviews.title: Wonderful location, great staff, lovely cooked breakfast.

reviews.text: Best bits: the cooked breakfast, especially the sausages, was very good, as was the dining room. The staf, and easily found baby cot.
reviews.title: Truly Memorable

reviews.text: Downsides: at 90 sterling it was on the higher side of pricing. The bathroom in our room was small and the shower uncomfortably so, though functional.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: Had our wedding here and all our guests stayed over, the management couldn't do enough for everyone, even serving breakfast after it had finished because we got up late. It's a beautiful setting with a gorgeous lake and lovely walks around the grounds and nearby, there are also some excellent pubs nearby.
reviews.title: Absolutely great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently attended a wedding at the "Barns", which was a lovely venue, well executed, and with a great staff. Our stay in one of the "farmhouse rooms" was very convenient and accomodating -- the room was small, but well equipped with very comfortable beds, coffee & tea making equipment, and a small bathroom with the best shower I had in a week of travelling in the UK. Breakfast in the morning was great, with an assortment of juces, cereals, fruits, etc. as well as a buffet of hot breakfast items. The views from the dining room are stunning! The staff were very helpful with directions and area suggestions. We would love to go back!
reviews.title: Great wedding venue and accomodation

reviews.text: I stayed at the Sandhole Farm for my cousins wedding on the 26th August 2012 and it was lovely. I stayed in room 33 in the house and it was a lovely genourous sized room with ensuite. The only thing I would say is the shower in the ensuite is not up to much but you cannot have everything. The owners were great even providing a nice bottle of wine for the room (no bar facilities on site unless you are attending a function in the barn). The site is to die for with a nice lake and decking area to the barn which was brilliant for milling out onto at the evening party! Definately would stay here again. Great value for money.
reviews.title: Great B&B and brilliant wedding venue

reviews.text: I attended my nephew's wedding yesterday. What a delightfully unique location. The main room overlooks open green fields and a pretty lake. The service and food were exquisite. Everyone who attended gave the occasion a 100% thumbs up. The icing on the cake (apologies for the pun) was the overnight accommodation; these rooms seem as if they were converted from farm buildings; they are perfection with every facility required to top off an exhilarating day. This morning the families gathered for a wonderfully traditional breakfast accompanied by the sight of rabbits playing in the adjoining field. Fabulous.
reviews.title: A perfect wedding venue

reviews.text: We were guests at a wedding here last weekend. A beautiful setting on the lake, very personal and intimate wedding ceremony, exquisitely presented wedding breakfast with gourmet food to die for. The quiet time prior to evening guests arriving was spent relaxing in the gardens and the evening buffet was excellent a wonderful place set in the countryside of Congleton.
reviews.title: Book your wedding now!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Attended as guests. Were blessed by weather but either way - this is perfect venue. Family run - not very corporate - in idyllic location. Food service and wedding organization seemed pretty flawless. Room and breakfast very good. I couldn't imagine a much better UK based wedding or special occasion experience
reviews.title: Great Wedding Venue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Attended a Wedding here at the weekend & stayed overnight. Great location for a Wedding celebration. Accommodation is B&B. Nice staff, good food. Function rooms overlook a large lake. Very enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Lovely spot for a Wedding
